Lists

Lists are used to organize related content vertically.

Examples

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Bulleted List

Bulleted lists are used to display information in a format that is easily scanned by users.

The Bulleted List

  • This is a bulleted list item.
  • This is a bulleted list item.
  • This is a bulleted list item.
  • This is a bulleted list item.

Line Separated List

Alternatively, line separated lists can be used to display information in a scannable format.

Line Separated List of Activities

  • Payment Reversal
    Reference #
    0908766047
  • Finance Request Pending
    Reference #
    0908766044
  • Finance Request Pending
    Reference #
    09087632032
  • Payment Reversal
    Reference #
    0908766357

Basic List

Short or simple lists can use a basic list style, without bullets or line dividers.

Quick Links

  • What's New?
  • JDPC(Parts Catalog)
  • Order Zone
  • Warranty Reports
  • John Deere Reman

Labeled List

Labeled lists include both labels and values, and are often used to display a userâ€™s previously entered data for the sake of review or summary. Labels should be displayed above their corresponding value for best scanability. However, lists can also be be displayed horizontally to conserve space or accommodate text-heavy lists.

Labeled List Best Option

Quote #
987987
Dealership
Brandt Tractor
Store Location
Moline, IL
Salesperson
Timothy Green

Labeled List for Limited Space

Quote #
987987
Dealership
Brandt Tractor
Store Location
Moline, IL
Salesperson
Timothy Green

Guidelines

Use lists to present simple information in an organized way. For more complex data sets, use a table.

  • Use an ordered list to imply sequence or order, like when giving a set of instructions.
  • Use unordered lists when each item should be represented with equal status or value.
  • Sort list items alphabetically, or in another logical way.

Documentation

Bootstrap Documentation

Modifiers

Class Description
.uxf-ul add class to a ul element to apply recommended bulleted list styles
.uxf-line-separated add class to ul.list-unstyled or ol.list-unstyled to apply line separated list styles
.uxf-dl add class to a dl element to apply recommended labeled list styles
.uxf-dl-horizontal add class to a dl.uxf-dl element to apply recommended horizontal labeled list styles

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2

  1. Change ul .line-separated to ul .uxf-line-separated
  2. Change ul .bulleted.thin-list to div .uxf-ul
  3. Change div.description-pair to dl.uxf-dl-horizontal
  4. Change div.left-content to dt
  5. Change div.right-content to dd
  6. Change dl .horizontal.thin-list to dl .uxf-dl-dropdown
  7. Change dl .standard to dl .uxf-dl
  8. Add .list-unstyled to ul.uxf-line-separated
